title: Manipulate Arrays With unshift Method
content: Not only can you shift elements off of the beginning of an array, you can also unshift elememts to the beginning of an array i.e add elements in front of the array.
.unshift() works exactly like .push(), but instead of adding the elements at the end of the array, unshift() adds the element at the beginning of the array.
After the shift, ourArray would have the value ['J', 'cat']. After the unshift, ourArray would have the value ['Happy','J','cat']

exercises.instruction: Add ['Paul', 35] to the beginning of the myArray variable using unshift().
